title: 104_s2012
content: The National Cemetery System of the Department of Veterans Affairs is now called the National Cemetery Administration. The Director of the National Cemetery System is now known as the Assistant Secretary for Memorial Affairs. The Assistant Secretary for Memorial Affairs is added as an additional position in the Department of Veterans Affairs. Other Assistant Secretaries are specified to exclude the Assistant Secretary for Memorial Affairs. Amendments are made to Title 38 to reflect these changes. Title 38, United States Code, is amended to replace "Director of the National Cemetery System" with "Assistant Secretary for Memorial Affairs" in various sections. This change also includes replacing "System" with "Administration" in certain subsections. Section 2306(d) of title 38, United States Code is amended to replace "within the National Cemetery System" with "under the control of the National Cemetery Administration". Additionally, the table of sections in chapter 24 is amended to reflect the change to "Establishment of National Cemetery Administration". The heading and sections of title 38, United States Code are amended to establish the National Cemetery Administration and appoint an Assistant Secretary. The National Cemetery Administration is responsible for national cemeteries and facilities under its control. The National Cemetery Administration is responsible for cemeteries and facilities under its control, as outlined in various sections of title 38, United States Code. These sections are amended to reflect the Administration's authority over these facilities. Section 2408(c) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to specify that the National Cemetery Administration has control over the cemeteries mentioned in the section. SEC. 5. Executive Schedule Conforming Amendment. Section 5315 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by changing the numbering for Assistant Secretaries, Department of Veterans Affairs and removing the Director of the National Cemetery System. SEC. 6. References in Other Laws. SEC. 6. REFERENCES IN OTHER LAWS. Any mention of the National Cemetery System in federal laws or documents related to the Department of Veterans Affairs will now refer to the National Cemetery Administration. Similarly, references to the Director of the National Cemetery System will now refer to the Assistant Secretary for Memorial Affairs.
